conversion_verification.notes: Second image is an angled cutaway/isometric-style 3D model with extruded walls (height + thickness), visible top/side faces, and exposed interior volumes.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall extrusion with thickness, readable floor/wall separation, good corner geometry, and a clean roofless cutaway; minor simplification of some edges/openings.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and adjacency match well (central living/dining core, kitchen at lower-left, bedrooms on left and right wings, bathrooms near top). Some perimeter opening placement/spacing and a few room proportions appear slightly adjusted versus the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture and fixtures are present (beds, sofas, dining table, kitchen counters/appliances, bathroom fixtures). Mostly placed in correct rooms with generally reasonable scale; some simplified/blocky representations.

visual_clarity.notes: Walls/floors/openings are distinguishable and the model is readable. Lighting is adequate but relatively flat; door-swing arcs on the floor add slight visual clutter and some window geometry is understated.

detected_errors.description: Windows/openings along the exterior perimeter appear simplified and may not match the exact count/positions shown in the 2D plan.
Minor proportional drift: a few rooms/walls appear slightly resized or shifted relative to the 2D drawing, though overall adjacency remains consistent.
Door swing arcs rendered on the floor reduce architectural clarity slightly (presentation/legibility issue rather than geometry).

summary: A true cutaway 3D conversion with strong layout fidelity and complete interiors, with only minor proportional and window/opening placement simplifications versus the 2D plan.
